sect1.title: What is ArchGenXML?
sect1.para: With ArchGenXML you can create working python code without writing one single line of python. It is is a commandline utility that generates fully operational Plone applications (Products) based on the Archetypes framework from UML models using XMI (.xmi, .zargo, .zuml) files.

Design your Archetypes (code for content objects in plone) offline using a UML design tool like Poseidon or ObjectDomain. Export the UML to XMI or XSD and use ArchGenXML to generate Phyton code for use as a Product. This new Product is available as a new item (document) type in the Plone userinterface.
This time the tool is not round-trip enabled: Generated code can't be back-converted into XMI. But you can re-generate over existing code: The Method bodys and some other protected sections are kept.
ArchGenXML is hosted at sourceforge.net as a subproject of the archetypes project. It's under GNU General Public Licence 2 or later.

listitem.para: You don't like to reinvent the wheel,
You dont like copy and pasting code and bugs,
You make heavy use of references and interfaces,
You have big projects with many different custom types,
You structured model- and pattern-driven software development,
You want to maintain your project also in future without getting headache,
and many more good and odd other reasons.

sect2.title: Preconditions
sect2.para: You need a working Python Version 2.1 or later, Version 2.3 is recommended.
Also you need Plone 2 (choose latest stable release) and its dependencies to see your generated code in action.

sect2.title: Download
sect2.para: You need to download a release tar-ball from sourceforge. You'll find it in the releases area of archetypes. Choose the latest version of your flavor: Final, or one of the cutting edge development releases.
Its also possible to fetch the code of cutting edge development from CVS. How to check it out is described well in sourceforge's manuals. Project name is archetypes and module name is ArchGenXML.

sect2.title: Installation
sect2.para: Simply un-tar downloaded file to a place of your choice and remember the path to ArchGenXML.py.
I suggest to give the file execution permissions and make a symbolic link at a place mentioned in your PATH environment settings.
Note: The installation will be handled bei dist-utils in one of the next releases and will become much easier then.
